subject: Art & Design
title: CGI: From Jurassic Park to Everything
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on CGI: From Jurassic Park to Everything.

hook.text: When the T. Rex appeared in Jurassic Park (1993), audiences gasped. CGI dinosaurs looked completely real.

buildup.text: Computer-Generated Imagery (CGI) creates visual elements digitally that would be impossible or too dangerous to film.

discovery.text: Spielberg used CGI for only 6 minutes of Jurassic Park. The rest was practical effects and clever editing.

twist.text: Bad CGI ages terribly. Good CGI is invisible â€” you don't even realize you're looking at it.

climax.text: Films like Avatar and Planet of the Apes show CGI can create emotion, not just spectacle.

punchline.text: The best CGI is the CGI you don't notice.

quiz.question: How much CGI did Jurassic Park actually use for dinosaurs?
